answers.answer: Don't be worried! Your dr will defiantly tell you if your baby is big or not.My mum didn't have diabetes with my older brother and he was natural 10pound baby, she had diabetes with my little brother and he was way less then my older brother. Your in the best care try not to stress!
Don't worry. It's possible, but not a given, especially of yours in under control.

That's why it's important to have the testing done. Since you got your diagnosis early enough to make changes, you're keeping it well controlled and staying active, you're not likely to have a baby that's much bigger than normal. Remember of course that the range of what's "normal" is pretty big... but you're doing the right things. Keep it up and everything is gonna work out okay.
Thanks,I think its mostly my nerves getting to me.

question: I have gestational diabetes and I keep reading that people with this can have big babies. I keep my sugars low and I walk everyday I even lost weight. When I went for my two week check up my doctor said she wasn't worried to much but I get another ultrasound when I am 35 weeks. Now I'm worried -.-
title: now i am worried.....
